channel.title: 华尔街日报

item.title: 它看起来就像一个标准的纽约市停车场。但自 2024 年初以来，这座位于曼哈顿西村的建筑已经签订了超过 1 亿美元的交易。
item.description:
It looks like your standard New York City parking garage. But since the beginning of 2024, more than $100 million in deals have been inked at the building in Manhattan's West Village. https://t.co/We74WREuEK https://t.co/We74WREuEK

item.title: 选民选择玛丽亚-科里纳-马查多（Maria Corina Machado）在总统选举中挑战委内瑞拉政权。
item.description:
Maria Corina Machado, whom voters chose to challenge the Venezuelan regime in presidential elections, said that she is stepping aside and that a little-known professor is taking her place in the July vote https://t.co/LqQIMe8ooY https://t.co/LqQIMe8ooY

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：美国人明白，在威斯康星或阿拉斯加寒冷的冬天，没有一辆特斯拉能正常行驶；没有一辆福特 "闪电 "能胜任农场的工作。他们明白禁令意味着整个生活方式的终结，@KimStrassel 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Americans understand that no Tesla is going to function in the cold of a Wisconsin or Alaska winter; no Ford Lightning will manage the work of a farm. They understand a ban means the end of entire lifestyles, writes @KimStrassel. https://t.co/b3BEl1MUaA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国职业棒球大联盟已对大谷翔平及其前翻译和私人助理水原一平展开调查，原因是这两人与加利福尼亚州的一家非法博彩公司有关联。
item.description:
Major League Baseball has opened an investigation into Shohei Ohtani and his former interpreter and personal assistant Ippei Mizuhara over the pair’s association with an illegal bookmaker in California https://t.co/dGGdJFuAEv https://t.co/dGGdJFuAEv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 莫斯科郊外一个音乐厅发生袭击事件，造成至少 40 人死亡，100 多人受伤。美国官员认为 ISIS 与此次袭击有关。
item.description:
The U.S. warned Russia of a plot to target large crowds ahead of an attack that killed at least 40 people and injured over 100 at a concert hall outside of Moscow. U.S. officials believe ISIS was linked to the attack. https://t.co/Ftla81UbD4 https://t.co/Ftla81UbD4

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 维多利亚-贝克汉姆（Victoria Beckham）知道你想谈论那**劳斯莱斯备忘录。以下是事情的经过，以及她日常生活中的 20 多个细节。
item.description:
Victoria Beckham knows you want to talk about *that* Rolls-Royce meme. Here's how it happened, plus 20-odd more details from her daily life. https://t.co/YN3qRTh6M8 https://t.co/YN3qRTh6M8

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 我受邀进入手术室，亲眼目睹了脑机接口的植入过程。我们将与患者（杜邦公司前首席财务官）见面，了解 BCI 的工作原理，认识其背后的创新者，并聆听首席执行官关于将其推向市场的计划。 via @WSJ
item.description:
I was invited me into the operating room to witness a brain-computer interface being implanted. Meet the patient, a former CFO of Dupont; learn how the BCI works; meet the innovator behind it; and hear the CEO's the plan to get it to market. https://t.co/xUVy6QONoy via @WSJ

— Jo Craven McGinty (@mcjomcg) March 22, 2024

item.title: 据报道，世界各地的女性对自己的生活比男性更苦恼，也更满意。华尔街日报》的 @EmilyBobrow 提问：这是怎么回事？
item.description:
Women around the world report being both more distressed and more satisfied with their lives than men. WSJ's @EmilyBobrow asks, what’s going on? https://t.co/AfGEHuo4UQ https://t.co/AfGEHuo4UQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: Truth Social 用户少、收入低，预计将于下周开始在股票市场交易，估值约为 50 亿美元--这是特朗普支持者疯狂购买的结果。
item.description:
Truth Social, with few users and little revenue, is expected to start trading on the stock market next week at a staggering valuation around $5 billion—the result of frenzied buying by Trump supporters https://t.co/FBtmFVW8gq https://t.co/FBtmFVW8gq

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 这款手袋具有香奈儿经典款式的所有特征：奢华的绗缝皮革、闪亮的金色配件、精致的缝线。但它却是一个毫无价值的赝品。
item.description:
The handbag had all the hallmarks of a classic Chanel: sumptuous quilted leather, sparkling gold hardware, delicate stitching. But it was a worthless fake. https://t.co/2CqUPPR7ip https://t.co/2CqUPPR7ip

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: "可被他人发现"？苹果公司默认开启了一个听起来令人毛骨悚然的 iPhone 设置，导致许多人认为他们的信息在不知情或未经同意的情况下被共享了。以下是为什么它并不可怕--以及如何关闭它。
item.description:
“Discoverable by Others”? Apple turned a creepy-sounding iPhone setting on by default, leading many to think their information is being shared without their knowledge or consent. Here’s why it’s not so scary—and how to turn it off. https://t.co/FBPKM8gyx6 https://t.co/FBPKM8gyx6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 人们深知失去亲人的悲痛。但是，人们对慢性疾病带来的悲痛却不甚了解。
item.description:
People are well aware of the grief that comes with losing a loved one. But less well understood is the grief that comes with chronic illness. https://t.co/nqn5OBKjGj https://t.co/nqn5OBKjGj

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 也许你很难相信，曾经的爱尔兰酒吧如今已奄奄一息。沿着爱尔兰令人惊叹的狂野大西洋路（Wild Atlantic Way）进行的公路旅行，可以让我们一睹一些保留下来的酒吧。(更正错字）
item.description:
It may be hard to believe, but Irish pubs as they once were are a dying breed. This road trip along Ireland's stunning Wild Atlantic Way offers a glimpse of some holdouts. (corrects typo) https://t.co/YoHv0qmB5q https://t.co/YoHv0qmB5q

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 突发事件：美国联邦航空局（FAA）在最近几周接连发生安全问题后，正在加强对美国联合航空公司的审查
item.description:
Breaking: The FAA is stepping up scrutiny of United Airlines following a spate of safety issues in recent weeks https://t.co/sEiQZGNVAg https://t.co/sEiQZGNVAg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: "要么你结束这一切，要么我走人"在华盛顿特区的一个富人区，一桩少棒丑闻让位高权重的家长们相互对立，并导致了一项发现。
item.description:
“Either you end this crap, or I’m walking.” A Little League scandal in a tony part of Washington, D.C., pits high-powered parents against one another—and leads to a discovery. https://t.co/NKigKfI844 https://t.co/NKigKfI844

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）说他希望获得压倒性胜利，但贬低重要的选举工具并不会给他带来胜利。接受提前投票是他和所有共和党人取得胜利的关键，@JohnMTillman 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Donald Trump says he wants a landslide, but disparaging crucial electoral tools won’t give him one. Embracing early voting is key to the victory he and all Republicans seek, writes @JohnMTillman. https://t.co/TvThSwj7mN

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 22, 2024

item.title: 也许你很难相信，曾经的爱尔兰酒吧如今已奄奄一息。沿着爱尔兰令人惊叹的狂野大西洋路（Wild Atlantic Ways）的公路旅行，我们可以看到一些保留下来的酒吧。

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：弗拉基米尔-普京自信满满。但如果经济下滑或俄罗斯军队失去动力，俄罗斯民众是否会反对他？

item.title: 没有一个国家愿意被称为 "香蕉共和国"，参议员查尔斯-舒默和以色列参议员本雅明-内塔尼亚胡之间的公开争论正是围绕这个词展开的。
item.description:

item.title: 最新消息：俄罗斯当局称，莫斯科郊外的一个音乐厅发生爆炸，枪手向音乐会观众开火，造成至少 40 人死亡。
